term.title: current density

item.text: The current density jB of a species B in a given point of the solution is obtained by multiplying the flux density of that species at the given point by the Faraday constant F and by the charge number z B of the species: jB = zB.F.NB is a vector which indicates the direction in which the charges transported by the species B flow and which gives the number of these charges going through a plane oriented perpendicular to the vector, divided by time and by area, and N B is the flux density of a minor constituent of the solution with respect to a fixed frame of reference.

sources.item: PAC, 1981, 53, 1827. 'Nomenclature for transport phenomena in electrolytic systems' on page 1833 (https://doi.org/10.1351/pac198153101827)

Users of these terms are encouraged to include the version of a term with its use and to check regularly for updates to term definitions that you are using.
